sentences.en: "How did he meet your mother?" — "I don't know."
sentences.cn: “他怎么认识你母亲的？”——“我不知道。”

sentences.en: A terrible sight met their eyes.
sentences.cn: 一幅可怕的景象映入他们的眼帘。

sentences.en: British manufacturing failed to meet the crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.cn: 英国制造业未能经受住20世纪70年代危机的考验。

sentences.en: He should have stuck to his guns and refused to meet her.
sentences.cn: 他本应坚持己见，拒绝与她会面。

sentences.en: I am prepared to meet him halfway by paying him a further £25,000.
sentences.cn: 我愿意让步，再付给他25,000英镑。

sentences.en: I was worried I might meet Henry on the bus.
sentences.cn: 我担心可能会在公共汽车上遇到亨利。

sentences.en: I’ll meet you by the main reception desk.
sentences.cn: 我在总接待处等你。

sentences.en: Let's meet in the cocktail lounge at the Hilton.
sentences.cn: 我们在希尔顿酒店的酒吧间碰头吧。

sentences.en: Make sure to meet them at the other end.
sentences.cn: 确保在另一边与他们会合。

sentences.en: Many of Britain's beaches fail to meet minimum standards of cleanliness.
sentences.cn: 英国许多海滩连最起码的卫生标准都达不倒。

sentences.en: Meet me at 8.00.
sentences.cn: 八点钟来见我。

sentences.en: My understanding was that we'd meet at her place.
sentences.cn: 我的理解是我们在她那儿见面。

sentences.en: Out of the original 23,000 applications, 16,000 candidates meet the entry requirements.
sentences.cn: 最初的2.3万份申请中有1.6万份满足入选的要求。

sentences.en: Parallel lines will never meet no matter how far extended.
sentences.cn: 无论延伸多长，平行线永不相交。

sentences.en: People assume they know me through and through the moment we meet.
sentences.cn: 人们一见到我，就自以为对我了如指掌了。

sentences.en: She met his gaze without flinching.
sentences.cn: 她毫不畏缩地与他对视。

sentences.en: She was afraid to meet my eye(s).
sentences.cn: 他不敢正眼看我。

sentences.en: The Monsignor turned his gaze from the flames to meet the Colonel's.
sentences.cn: 这位大人凝视的目光离开火苗，与上校的目光相遇。

sentences.en: the sight that met his eyes was truly amazing.
sentences.cn: 他看到的景象真是令人惊叹。

sentences.en: The three parties will meet next month to work out remaining differences.
sentences.cn: 三方将在下个月会面，以解决余下的分歧。

sentences.en: Their eyes met across the crowded room.
sentences.cn: 他们的目光隔着拥挤的房间相遇了。

sentences.en: We arranged to meet outside the theatre.
sentences.cn: 我们说好在剧院外面碰头。

sentences.en: We tend to meet up for lunch once a week.
sentences.cn: 我们往往每周共进一次午餐。

sentences.en: We were not able to meet the deadline because of manufacturing delays.
sentences.cn: 因为制造方面的延误，我们没能赶上最后期限。

sentences.en: When you meet him, he is disarming as he talks about himself.
sentences.cn: 当你遇到他时，他谈论起自己时总是能让人放下戒心。

sentences.en: You’ll never guess who I met in town.
sentences.cn: 你绝对猜不出我在镇上碰到谁了。

phrases.tran_cn: 应变；应急；应付紧急情况
与某人达成妥协，对某人作出让步

phrases.phrase: meet someone's eye (look;gaze), people's eyes meet

phrases.tran_cn: 赶上最后期限；按期完成

phrases.phrase: there's more to someone/sth than meets the eye
phrases.tran_cn: 某人(或物)比料想的更为复杂(或有趣)

trans.tran_en: a sports competition between people running races, jumping over bars etc
to go to a place where someone will be at a particular time, according to an arrangement, so that you can talk or do something together

trans.tran_cn: 遇见，碰到，结识，迎接，集合，会晤，交锋，满足，偿付，和…接触，遭遇
trans.tran_en: to see someone by chance and talk to them
